availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Ohio
Hamilton County
City of Cincinnati } SS

I, John G. Douglass, residing in the City of Cincinnati, County of Hamilton and State of Ohio appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky a Commissioner for the State of Ohio to take the proof and acknowledgment of deeds and other instruments &c pursuant to an act of the Legislature of the said State, entitled "An act to adopt the Revised Statutes" Approved January 7" 1852, do solemnly swear that I will well and truly and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such commissioner under and by virtue of the laws of Kentucky.
Signed in my presence and sworn to before me by the said John G. Douglass this Eighteenth day October AD 1865
A Justice of the Peace in and for Cincinnati Township Ham Co Ohio

Comr Deeds
Ohio
Oath of John G. Douglass
filed 23d Oct 1865
